website_summaries.verdict: A professional-quality car monitor with a simple-to-use smartphone app for displaying information.
pros: Included app translates difficult-to-understand codes into simple alerts
Connecting monitor to the car and a smartphone is a straightforward process
cons: Does not track other information such as airbag status and ABS lights
Not compatible with diesel or electric vehicles

customer_reviews.title: Didnt work as advertised, most striking feature is that it asks you for more money
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't recognize all the codes... but of course you can pay to call for more information. Like it doesn't talk to the internet through your phone and could not retrieve this information like it says it will when you buy it. The fancy screen shown on the description page does nothing. Did not clear the engine light as advertised. Why your car does not tell you the codes these days is a racket in itself, this thing might be a decent idea if it worked as advertised but it simply does not and is mostly useful for mining you for more cash. How many people were paid to write reviews on this thing who knows.
customer_reviews.author: Hanisch78

customer_reviews.title: Car nearly stalls in middle of the road and this say all is A-OK!!!
customer_reviews.text: I can't get it to tell me what is wrong with my car. My car keeps stuttering when I try to start from a stop light but this thing keeps telling me that everything is OK with my car! How is everything OK with my car if my feels like its about to die in the middle of the road??!?!?!?! What a total and complete waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Runner4Life

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Great device. I have check engine light on. Already knew it was catalytic issue. When I plugged in device. It informed me that it is the catalytic converter and that it would cost $2000. Was able to clear it. Not repairing this item, and this device allows me to clear the check engine light. Now when the check engine light comes on, I will know exactly why it came on. This device tracks your battery, tires, and windshield wipers. Also, let's you know what maintenance is needed by your mileage. MY CAR IS A 2001 SUZUKI ESTEEM. Great Product for women to have, since mechanics love to rip off women.
customer_reviews.author: Enid in Puerto Rico

customer_reviews.title: Uninformative
customer_reviews.text: Intrusive and uninformative! Sent it back and purchased another OBD for half the money that actually provides information. The FIXD syncs up to your cell’s FIXD phone app that requires a login, your phone number and your location. Your car data is uploaded to their site and in the event your car throws an error code, it would alert you and recommend a mechanic (or I assume one may call). Bottom line, it didn’t provide status on the monitors in my car (of which some of them were not “OK” status) and it records your driving habits..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WHAT A JOKE!
customer_reviews.text: Makes all these claims that it will tell you whats wrong with your car, provide fix information, and alert you to problems. YEAH RIGHT! Ran the code, said I had a bad gas cap. Replaced it. No fix. App didnt suggest anything else to try so I took it to the mechanic. $700 later and tons of new parts my car is running great again. Mech said these things are really a waste unless you know what your doing and know something about cars. He said gascap is a common cause for my problem but that their claims of this helping to you fix your own car is a joke. Tossed it in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: JerBer

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for me
customer_reviews.text: I had two lights on on my dashboard, neither one were picked up by the sensor. I bought this so I wouldn’t have to go to an auto place to see why my service engine soon light or another light came on it and when those lights did come on but this product scanned and said that there were no problems detected even though my service engine soon light and my low tire pressure lights were both on
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: This was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: I feel that this purchase was a waste of money. IMy whole dashboard was lit up and this product showed nothing wrong. I have a Toyota Venza 2009. I also used it on my 2005 Toyota Highlander and it showed nothing wrong. The device that provides heat to the Highlander was not working and Fixit did not detect an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Darnell Morris

customer_reviews.title: Does not turn off the engine light
customer_reviews.text: 2007 Dodge Ram1500** Bluetooth works fine *** Diagnose seems good**** NOTE*** It will NOT turn off the engine light ! Took it to the dealership. Mechanic says his diagnostic tool costs $3600. He turned off my engine light immediately. On the way home it came back on again. Brake switch sensor....mechanic claims all is ok. Claims the code is archived. Mechanic says “ What do you expect for $60? Ok...... Sending this back.....
customer_reviews.author: Paul Framer Smith

customer_reviews.title: Less Than Useful: It Just Won't Work
customer_reviews.text: Sounds great, but less than useful. Followed the instructions, got the unit plugged in, the app found the sensor; the blue light on the unit flashed, once, twice, three times, then: communication lost. Over and over. Support was of next to no use at all, "Try another phone." So, I tried a different model iPhone and an Android phone and they both provided the very same experience
customer_reviews.author: Michael McGaw

customer_reviews.title: False alarms
customer_reviews.text: Plugged it in my Camry. Gave a few high level alerts with caveat that if my dashboard wasn't showing the same issue, then probably some internal computer diagnostic fluctuations, so I shouldn't be alarmed. Then what good is it? There is an upsell for a subscription based technician to help. I think those alerts were meant to scare you into subscribing. Return.
customer_reviews.author: James Ming

customer_reviews.title: I would like my money back
customer_reviews.text: I have tried to use this several times. I can connect fine to both cars. However, it has never returned an error code even when the control panel is indicating errors. This is 3rd time. It's rare that you woudl need it, so for it to not work 3 times is a complete waste of time. I tried to send a note to the seller, but never got a response. I would like my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Harris H.

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt read the check eninge light
customer_reviews.text: I have a check engine light on and every time I try to read it FIXD reports no codes are present. I needed to know what was wrong with my car so I ran it up to the car part store and they read a P0300 code with no problem. I have reached out to support but have yet to hear back from anybody so far. If I am able to get an answer to this and get it working I will update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Useless product
customer_reviews.text: This device is worthless a waste of money, ive tried over and over to get it going, its useless plain and simple Useless
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne

customer_reviews.title: It didn't work.
customer_reviews.text: I drive a 2008 BMW 535i. I have an issue that when cold, the engine is not happy if I accelerate before it warms up. The check engine light and a supposed cut in power occurs. I don't sense a power cut. I drove with this device plugged in for three weeks and three times the event happened. FIXD apparently did not see it...therefore no information. I tried it every which way I could but no luck. Before I sent it back, I tried it on a 2001 Honda Odyssey that had a check engine light on for months...and it seemed that just plugging it in cleared the light...but I got no information as to what just happened.
customer_reviews.author: jc

customer_reviews.title: Meh. I wasn’t impressed
customer_reviews.text: Does what it says but honestly it’s a glorified check engine light scanner. You can get cheaper ones that does the exact same thing. When the codes pop up, google it. It’s easy lol I’ll returning this and getting a cheaper one.
customer_reviews.author: David NGOc

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Completely incapable of synching more than once. The app just says failed to find sensor or unable to communicate, despite following instructions. Most of the error codes seem to have the advice of "contact a mechanic". This was a complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Hall

customer_reviews.title: Will not connect VIA Bluetoot to my phone - Useless Tool for me
customer_reviews.text: I cannot get this device to connect to my phone. it worked the first couple times and now it will not connect. contacted the help desk and they tried to help, but everything they recommended did not work. I asked for a replacement and they said that because it was purchased through Amazon there was nothing they could do. Not Happy With This Item At All.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Hall

customer_reviews.title: Does not reset engine light on Land Rover LR2
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking forward to using this product, but after reading the instructions and plugging it into the port it was not able to turn off the check engine light on my Land Rover. It was able to diagnose and tell me the source of my check engine light but just not able to reset the light itself. It’s unfortunate.
customer_reviews.author: mauricio Torre

customer_reviews.title: Works 1 time out of 5. You have to have 5 bars on your data plan.
customer_reviews.text: This device Looks like a godsend. But its not. It "Connects" one time out of 5. It constantly needs to "Check results" and it constantly seems to be "Seeking" the phone you use. However, it does allow you to reset the lights on your auto when the indication is not "major. It only takes 15 or so tries.
customer_reviews.author: JJMcDonald

customer_reviews.title: I had high hopes for this product
customer_reviews.text: This product did not work as advertised. I had lights come on with my 16 Jeep Wrangler and it couldn’t detect any problems. Kinda scary when that’s it’s only job. Contacted support and they said they have yet to support all vehicles. Wow.
customer_reviews.author: T. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Not quite ready...
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, right technology, but not implemented well. I have a 2014 Jeep Wrangler and have not gotten this thing to identify anything yet. The good news is the hardware is in place, so if they get the soft as re right this could be an awesome tool. Fingers crossed.
customer_reviews.author: CHRISTOPHER WICKES

customer_reviews.title: Poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't get it to communicate with my phone for whatever reason and couldn't get any Customer Support I'm sure if this thing works from what I seen it works great I saw another person that had it and it was awesome but mine was not so much in my customer service experience wasn't very good either
customer_reviews.author: James Schafer

customer_reviews.title: All lights on dashboard are lit up like a Christmas tree
customer_reviews.text: Very unhappy with this product. Occasionally all my lights come on. Installed this device and phone app states no lights detected. All lights on dashboard are lit up like a Christmas tree.
customer_reviews.author: onlyoneway

customer_reviews.title: Just another OBD.  No insight.
customer_reviews.text: Well I guess you need the "check engine" light on at all times. My Jeep has 2 idiot lights on and a known electrical problem in the vehicle. FIXD didn't detect a single problem. I was hoping for more comprehensive, over all notification output...you know "Active Car Health Monitor". I mean, it didn't pick up on the problems I know about currently in the vehicle, how many problems that it doesn't know about do I have to have before the diagnosis is worth it? Nowhere close to what I expected. Just another OBD...
customer_reviews.author: Muscman

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing.  Did not work well on 2007 BMW
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to decode and reset BMW codes. Really not very extensive library of codes. Would not reset brake indicator. Once diagnosed, the app continuously tried to offer sources for repairs. Not what I needed
customer_reviews.author: J. Hudson

customer_reviews.title: DON’T BUY IT
customer_reviews.text: Before I used it I had a check engine light on so when I plugged it in and it worked and everything but it’s sad that there was nothing detected in the car but the light was clearly on I do not recommend you getting this I took a chance on buying this even though I had bad reviews Do not waste your money not worth it!
customer_reviews.author: miguel

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t meet expectations. Log is inoperable and does NOT keep record of scans (MORE)
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t meet expectations. Log is inoperable and does NOT keep record of scans for my 02 Honda Accord. Apparently limited usability for older model vehicles. UPDATES & FIXES occur far too often and have little effect for my vehicle & personal experience with this device.
customer_reviews.author: JIM C., HoustonTX

customer_reviews.title: Kind of a pain the rear to set up..
customer_reviews.text: First, you hae to make sure that your iPhone is new enough to support the app (my personal one was not) then you have to follow steps in perfect order to install. So, make sure you have your registration, reading glasses and flashlight on hand. Once it is finally installed and running it works fine- it read that my MAF sensor needed cleaning adn that was the only error code. So now I can figure out whether I want to do that myself or have it done and go in with some foreknowledge. Of course the tech at McRipOff BMW Service could always say these things are crap and I really need $4k worth of service..
customer_reviews.author: tmp

customer_reviews.title: Product does not work
customer_reviews.text: When we received the monitor it would not scan. We emailed for assistance but they only said we needed to make sure we were connected to the internet. Expensive item that doesn't do what it is supposed to do. Very little assistance from the seller. Had to select one star but really wouldn't rate it with a one at all.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Baker

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and install
customer_reviews.text: Product was easy to install. App seemed to work as it should, but I guess I was expecting more from it. It gave the same code as my jeep displayed. Jeep gave catalytic converters, which coul be the converter, one of 4 o2 sensors, or exhaust manifold leak. I was hoping it would narrow it down, but due to the nature of the problem I guess I was expecting too much. Still a nice product!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer books are too discriptive

customer_reviews.title: Did it tell me why the engine light was on ...
customer_reviews.text: Did it tell me why the engine light was on? Yes. (Loose gas cap) It didn't help reset the light. Fixd said it reset the fault code, but nothing happened. It took two weeks for the light to finally go out. It also doesn't let me read any other codes
customer_reviews.author: Vanwilliam

customer_reviews.title: The  product arrived as promised and the price is about right.
customer_reviews.text: However the spouse tried using FIXD and followed the instructions and she said there were No Error Code on FIXD. However, the on board dash on the Impala shows oil pressure low stop engine. We have a faulty oil sensor. This product (FIXD) did not deliver as promised!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Real time data only works in landscape mode
customer_reviews.text: Was fairly easy to set up and get a diagnosis. What I didn’t like was the live data feature. The gauges only work intermittently even after re-connecting. I have to constantly re-install the gauges. All temperature is in Celsius ( should convert for you). The gauge panel only works in landscape mode.
customer_reviews.author: JAD

customer_reviews.title: Does not recognize automotive issues as expectied
customer_reviews.text: My ABS light was on. I purchased to diagnose the code and clear it when fixed. After registering and loading iPhone app and pairing the device, the FIXD System did NOT recognize that my ABS light was on and did not provide the code as other devices will. I have to assume the item I received is defective. Luckily I tested it immediately after receiving and am sending back. A wast of time but these things happen I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Big Mikey

customer_reviews.title: Over hyped & Overpriced
customer_reviews.text: So much buzz about this thing but I also purchased a $10 scanner to go with and it does just the same thing. The only extra thing this does is try to sell you on extra crap you don't need and tells you information you can lookup for free online with a 2 second Google search. Save the $50 and just get the cheap ones.
customer_reviews.author: John Baird

customer_reviews.title: MONTHLY SUBSCRIPTION!
customer_reviews.text: To use all the features of this device you need a subscription. $4.99 a month. Its not a lot but if you aren't expecting it then its really just irritating more than anything. After you get the error code and call around shops they still have to do their diagnosis too. So whats the point of doing it twice this device is only worth it if you plan on doing repairs yourself in my opinion. I also had trouble downloading the app it took several tries to actually install the app it seemed to freeze multiple times. It is user friendly and easy to set up thats about it.
customer_reviews.author: J.V.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t tell everything you need to know
customer_reviews.text: I like that it tellls me the engine code. But it only tells you the engine code and not what is wrong with the car. I still have to take car to a mechanic to evaluate the system for the code given.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Cole

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work
customer_reviews.text: This product doesn't even tell you wants wrong with your car. I got 1 thing to pop up and it just says something is wrong with your car. No code and no description of the problem.... Thanks that's really helpful lmao. Terrible product. Even if this product was free I'd still never use it. It's crazy that companies get away with advertising that their product does something when it actually doesn't. Odd. Don't waste your money or time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Forces you to use their app, which has recurring costs for the "full/pro" features...don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Tried using this with other apps available like Torque pro, etc, and it's not even detected. You cannot manually connect to the device via Bluetooth $60 for something that forces you to use their specific app, which has recurring, higher costs. Spend your money on a 25-30 dollar OBD2 scanner that's compatible with pretty much all OBD based apps, and don't buy this trash.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: This is a rip-off
customer_reviews.text: This product is a cash grab, the Bluetooth didn't even work, with 4 different phones and 2 cars! You can easily buy a different OBD sensor for about $7 that does the same exact thing as this.
customer_reviews.author: Deacon

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine when it still worked.
customer_reviews.text: Well, I tried this out along with a different reader to compare both items. The Fixd unit was easy to set up but only lasted about a month. Meanwhile, the other reader is still kicking and the app actually has way more information that's useful. This reader was twice as much as the other reader. I was hoping I wouldn't be in that group of people who's reader only lasted a month also. Very disappointed. I had high hopes based on the other reviews.
customer_reviews.author: thuy payne

customer_reviews.title: Extra subscription need to even use the smog test part...
customer_reviews.text: They should tell you that is costs another $60 to use the Fixd sensor. Just another way to gouge customers. You can’t even see if your car will pass emissions without the yearly subscription...
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: Did not help me at all.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased years to diagnose my 2009 Chevy avalanche issue with the stabila track and traction control alarm. The alarm comes on and it has an icon on the dashboard that there’s a problem but this device tells me there’s absolutely nothing wrong with my truck. So far it’s a giant waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Edward L.

customer_reviews.title: DON'T DO IT.
customer_reviews.text: After a month, it stops working, then they want you to pay to connect your vehicle to the app or it quits on you and won't tell you a thing. The one I got reads different from the dealer. TOTAL OPPOSITE PROBLEM from what dealer said. Check your head before purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad Product- and even worse customer service - zero stars
customer_reviews.text: I'd give this gizmo zero stars if possible. It uses a canned routine maintenance schedule of 7,500 miles. If that is what your car manufacturer that is great. Otherwise- it is impossible to change. My car manufacturer recommends routine maintenance every 10,000 miles. I have emailed custormer support 4 times- each time getting an obtuse answer about converting from km to miles, "glad you love the FIXD", and how to input the current car mileage. The guy that responded called me by the wrong name (I'm male and he called me Susan). Buyer be aware. This product is being returned today. A complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Swimmer

customer_reviews.title: so not worth it....
customer_reviews.text: It tells me of 2 codes and replace one and it still says i need to replace it, wish i had returned it in the return window.
customer_reviews.author: raven

customer_reviews.title: need to put too much information for every car, time waste
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, to check a car you need to go through too much stuffs. And most of the time it doesn't connect. Asks for some password which is very annoying and it always says "wrong password". Why do you need to put VIN for every car you need to scan? I must say the features are nice but this is not user friendly at all because you need to spend a lot of time to scan. Some people do not have that much time to spend. Some readers gives you the codes in just seconds. Why waste so much time?
customer_reviews.author: mEtALoRd_TuRzA

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good product and all but they say it’s only recommended for use on 1 vehicle and seems pointless to me to buy 4. Once you create the name for it it can’t be changed and I messaged them about it and they wanted me to buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Bailey Mackey

customer_reviews.text: I won’t say this is a bad product but I can’t get it to show up on my IPhone 7 Plus but it did turn out the check engine light but I would have like to know why it came on in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Cpr

customer_reviews.title: 👎🏼
customer_reviews.text: More of a toy and for people who don't know how to use OBDII readers. Too much advertising rather than help solve the issues it trys to sell the consumer more.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Rikk

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Mine worked about 5 times and that was it. It does not clear the codes. Keep getting an "unknown error" as well. The Customer Service Responders have no idea what they're doing in my opinion. Save your money. Get something else or just go to a trusted mechanic.
customer_reviews.author: Kristoff O'Meally

customer_reviews.title: That included adding Wifi to the system that is no easy matter. I contacted Fixd and after a little ...
customer_reviews.text: It worked perfectly when I first set it up. A couple of days later to check it out, the system had deleted all the information I put in and I had to start all over.That included adding Wifi to the system that is no easy matter. I contacted Fixd and after a little conversation with an individual, I was turned over to a technician which was going to cost me. All though I believe the monitor is a good thing to have my only thoughts here is that this monitor is not going to operate very well. Please advise.
customer_reviews.author: big alc

customer_reviews.title: no diagnostic on my car
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work on my 2000 Nissan Altima, Yes i followed the instruction on how to connect the FIXD to my car and download app, but i clearly knew something was wrong with my car because it only go half a mile then cuts off while driving and it will run hot but the FIXD say nothing was wrong.
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Negative Stars
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't even get this to connect with my phone so.......... I guess that really says it all. Bought one that is a fraction of the price and it worked flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: E.O.

customer_reviews.title: Requires paid subscription to unlock features
customer_reviews.text: It was difficult to pair the sensor with the app, and the instructions for pairing were not accurate for my vehicle. The front page of the app is one big ad for in-app purchases, and it requires a subscription to use the full features of the sensor. The sensor gauge portion of the application was primitive, and the app didn't give access to underlying codes. The sensor did correctly diagnose that my battery amperage is low, which the dealer had warned me about. I bought the sensor because I was hoping to reset the battery conditioning codes when I swap out the battery.
customer_reviews.author: K. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Expensive tool with mediocre software
customer_reviews.text: Tool is on the more expensive side but it comes with its own app so I figured that it would be worth it. After having now played with it for a few months I still find myself turning to my cheap old OBD reader most often and other 3rtd party apps for a more user friendly mechanic geared experience. If you don't know much of anything about cars, and tjust want to know how urgent your CEL is, free roadside assistance, help buying parts etc etc.... this might be good for you. If your a DIY car guy like me, its kind of useless filled with lots of useless junk you don't really need.
customer_reviews.author: Toby Robbins

customer_reviews.title: Not as discribed
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to set up, but it didn’t diagnose the problem with my BMW. Very disappointed and not what I saw in videos that promote this product.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer golson

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat works...
customer_reviews.text: It does not say everything that is wrong with your vehicle. Sometimes it would say nothing detected, and other times it had one or two but then would go away.
customer_reviews.author: Kim E.

customer_reviews.title: Support staff very slow to respond they do not have a direct line
customer_reviews.text: The unit does not work. it doesn't work. Support is slow to respond via email , Very frustrating... I do not recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Vidal

customer_reviews.title: Testing Testing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to use with my 2004 Nissan Frontier (123,300 miles). I'm the original owner and I had only two issues with this truck but it wasn't because of the truck, it was because I disregarded the manufacturer's maintenance recommendations. The product is pretty simple to initially use and load. Initial diagnostic says, no issues. I currently don't plan on leaving the Scan tool plugged in even though it says you can because I don't really need those other features. I just need it for its diagnostic purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Lolo

customer_reviews.title: I could not get this to zink up with any ...
customer_reviews.text: I could not get this to zink up with any of my vehicles, we have 3 tried so many times, but I had to return it and I had to pay for shipping FYI.
customer_reviews.author: Ivonne

customer_reviews.title: What a waste of $$
customer_reviews.text: This thing states in the listing that it will "alert you as soon as a problem arises". However the last few days I have been driving with an SRS light on and this never reported anything.
customer_reviews.author: Jack S.

customer_reviews.title: Lacking detail info for car light indicators
customer_reviews.text: I found this device had limited abilities compared to the devices used by the car manufacturers. It does not inform you in detail why the car light indicators are on.
customer_reviews.author: Dena Siegel

customer_reviews.title: Only works one time.
customer_reviews.text: I could pair it with bluetooth one time and never managed to get the damned thing to work ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Jack G Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it, they're just trying to sell subscriptions
customer_reviews.text: I was so disappointed the majority of functionality only comes with and additional $60 a year subscription, so ridiculous
customer_reviews.author: zyn

customer_reviews.title: Not as smart or as sophisticated as you want it to be
customer_reviews.text: Not as smart or as sophisticated as you want it to be. Probably not even worth the price (currently at $60), but would be at a lower price point. Misses a lot of diagnostic issues, but detects others. Meh.
customer_reviews.author: Another Customer

customer_reviews.title: No, no, NO! It ain’t worth it folks!!
customer_reviews.text: Not worth $60. Especially when you run it finally and find out to get useful information, you have to “buy premium”. This is why I don’t take chances on gimmicks like this. But, I broke my rule this time because Amazon, whom I typically trust, said “this is the greatest thing since sliced bread”, or something to that effect. No more personal rule breaking. I’m gonna get with Amazon support and see if they’ll allow me to return even after my return window has closed. Fingers crossed folks In the meantime, again, know what you’re buying before you buy it. My vote: utter junk!
customer_reviews.author: Graham J Hill

customer_reviews.title: Does not work and I cannot get a refund (TERRIBLE PRODUCT)
customer_reviews.text: My car has the maintenance-required light on, and the product says that there is not problem what so ever. Now, I cannot get a refund because it has been so many months since I bought it. But how was I suppose to know if this device work correctly or not??? DO NOT BUY IT!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Buyers beware! Subscription required!
customer_reviews.text: I can’t actually review the product, because I never opened it. Looks nice, but you spend $70 to purchase and then download the app, only to see the “get” button is greyed out and the subscribe button as the only option. Which costs $7.99 a month monitoring. Yeah, I just wanted to check an engine light once or twice. Not subscribe to Hulu. Sent back and ordered one with a little more up front cost, but dose everything that this one can without a subscription.
customer_reviews.author: TKSbatcave

customer_reviews.title: FIXD NOT WORKING
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased a FIXD diagnostic item when I try you to in stall it is not accepting my vin number because it's not 17 numbers I have a Nissan Juke 2012 vehicle
customer_reviews.author: Philmore

customer_reviews.title: no I phone you can not read the data
customer_reviews.text: I AM WROTE A E MAIL TO JOHN GATTUSO CO.. THE PROBLEM IS I HAVE NO I phone to read the data. i am still in contact whit john
customer_reviews.author: Karl Beyer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work!
customer_reviews.text: Toyota Camry 2009. There are two maintenance needed lights on and after scanning 5 times FIXD could not detect anything wrong. Doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Nima A

customer_reviews.title: Ad is deceiving.
customer_reviews.text: Does the same thing as a $30 bosch scanner. Nowhere in the ad does it say it's $60 more for the upgrade of features. It just talks about what it can do. It won't run an emissions test on my Silverado. I have a nexas ns202 which does everything and more for $20 less. Actually I have deposed of it. Live and learn
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: You have to get an app and pay to use this.
customer_reviews.text: This is an entire lie where advertising is concerned. They fail to mention you need to pay to use it etc. Too much drama.
customer_reviews.author: 💎 Diamond

customer_reviews.title: Device whiped my on-board computer clean!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn’t informed that this device will reset/erase the data on my vehicle’s computer after a diagnostic test. I ran a test before taking the vehicle to the dealership for an appointment (as shown in your TV commercial) and my car failed the PA state emission test because there was no information on the system to evaluate. I now need to drive the car at least 100 miles before returning to the dealership for another test. This is a significant inconvenience to me. My opinion: if you have On-Star or similar system already you don’t need this gizmo.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Mccool

customer_reviews.title: Hidden fees, not worthy for individual drivers
customer_reviews.text: Hidden fees seen before starting the diagnostic inspection, this product is not worthy for individual drivers but may be worthy for auto mechanic shops.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must pay monthly fee to use
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a great product but it’s totally useless unless you pay a monthly fee to see the data. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Risley

customer_reviews.title: Unable to clear engine fault code
customer_reviews.text: A bit disappointed with this device as I specifically bought one that claimed it would clear fault codes. There is a button that can be clicked to clear the engine fault code, but it never worked. The dealer was able to clear the code without issue.
customer_reviews.author: P. Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time
customer_reviews.text: Tried it on a Silverado 2011. Waste of money, full signal bars on phone and never read it. Waste like two hours all together trying/hoping it work. I bought it because of the good star rate but I guess I just have bud luck with this item, I’ll return it today, less than 24 hrs from getting it from amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Israel

customer_reviews.title: Totally dissatisfied
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing pro about this. This is a basic odb2 reader. It provides what every other $5 odb2 reader provides however they have made an app and branded it to seem more than it is. Very misleading.
customer_reviews.author: JP & Shiho Azuma-Williams

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: After repairing a code it will not let you rescan the motor. Good only for maintaining service
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad or Good Idk Yet
customer_reviews.text: It's super confusing. I have to wait for a big problem with my car to be sure it works. Ik I need a new starter and wipers. It didn't pick that up. Just said no errors.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua L Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Causes problems on the my 2017 Honda CRV
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these and it caused all the lights on my radio and NAV to flash off and on all at once. Since I used it I have been having problems with my passenger seat belt indicator not working properly. I should have returned it but I am stuck with it now!!
customer_reviews.author: Paul S

customer_reviews.title: Used to be a great app, until they started charging $60 to do nothing.
customer_reviews.text: This used to be a great tool and app, a year ago when I bought it. Now, if you want to see the fix for certain error codes, you have to pay $60 for the premium version. BUT, all that $60 does is cause the app to crash whenever you click on a code. It doesn't actually do anything for you. Thanks a lot Fixd/Google. Great scam.
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: Bait and switch
customer_reviews.text: Use to give some ino now 1 week free after that you have to pay monthly. Stay away from this!
customer_reviews.author: Geoff Oleszkowicz

customer_reviews.title: Not with my vehicle
customer_reviews.text: Try as I did, I could not get this to work. Tried multiple times, even watched a video on line, for over an hour. I got a connection once when standing right next to my truck, but after that, even sitting in the driver's seat, it couldn't connect. Returned it to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Raymond

customer_reviews.title: This product did not work for me.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product thinking i could use it to help determine if something goes wrong on my cars. Got it downloaded on my phone. Did everything it said to do, and guess what? It did not work. I then thought maybe it has something to do with my car, so i tried it on two other cars that are newer. Still did not work. I would not recommend anyone wasting their money on this piece of crap. Sorry folks
customer_reviews.author: Gary A Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this all you see on tv is not like that nothing is free even if you want to read about
customer_reviews.text: After you get code next option is 1 week free after that you have to pay monthly
customer_reviews.author: Denis

customer_reviews.title: WHAT A FREAKING JOKE!
customer_reviews.text: Dont be fooled by the $60 price you pay here on Amazon. By the time you get everything setup they will have you in the hole for over $120 + $60 every year there after! There is no way in heck that my car has that many problems I need to pay them $60 every year, for this price I may as well just take my car to the mechanic every time and pay their diagnostic fee of $40. oooooooooor just run the car up to the auto store to get read! No way is that worth $60 a year............ Sent this piece of crap back right away.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Brice

customer_reviews.title: Read on...
customer_reviews.text: Does close to the same thing my $20.00 analyser does. Sorry, kinda disappointed..
customer_reviews.author: Mario Hamel

customer_reviews.title: No live personnel to assist with troubleshooting.
customer_reviews.text: A great waste of time. Followed instructions and watched video several times. iPhone will not detect FIXD. No live personnel to assist with troubleshooting. Frustrating! I would give it no stars if at all possible.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Kevin D Sabourin

customer_reviews.title: If you want more details about your car, you have to pay a monthly subscription fee.
customer_reviews.text: This product doesn’t provide much unless you subscribe and pay a monthly fee to get more details on the car. So far, it only tells me my tires are an issue. I was losing coolant and it gave no indication. Seems a bit pricey for what you get unless you pay the monthly subscription .
customer_reviews.author: Che

customer_reviews.title: RIPOFF
customer_reviews.text: Tons of stuff going wrong with my car but this isnt helping fix any of it. Wasted my time and money.,
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: I don't think it work properly and it costed me over $50
customer_reviews.text: I used it and it say no problems detected. I repeatedly over and over. I still have engine light. Can I get refund on this item?
customer_reviews.author: Roger Gillespie

customer_reviews.title: Nothing
customer_reviews.text: There was nothing said about having to pay extra 29.00 to get it read by some one claiming to be a mechanic junk for sure
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: didn't understand competely
customer_reviews.text: I bought the FIXD sensor because I thought it was going to help me know if the oil needed changing, not because of time but because of the condition of the car. I guess this woman just expects too much when I don't know enough.
customer_reviews.author: Bridge

customer_reviews.title: It provides codes and thats it!
customer_reviews.text: This doesn't do anything the cheaper version don't do. I thought the application would provide more layman details about the codes but it doesn't. I should have just went cheaper on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Trainer4u

customer_reviews.title: Unnecessary and Limited
customer_reviews.text: Only helpful if you know absolutely nothing about cars. It doesn’t even support all of the warning lights on your dashboard. Unnecessary unless you are elderly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It may not tell you anything
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to read the codes on my 2007 Lexus RX350, did not auto read the make or anything, said everything was fine, I have a maintenance light, engine light, but it said everything was fine. Tried it on our Honda, auto read make and some info but said everything was fine, NOT.... the Honda has a few codes that we saw at the auto parts store AFTER trying this prod.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Boulter

customer_reviews.title: Nothing special
customer_reviews.text: It doesnt do anything more than the $10 one I already had. Over priced, your paying for their marketing.
customer_reviews.author: UMMMMM

product_meta.title: FIXD OBD2 Professional Bluetooth Scan Tool & Code Reader for iPhone and Android
feature_bullets: Powerful Check Engine Light Diagnostics — Read and diagnose your check engine light, understand the severity of the issue, and clear that pesky light from your vehicle. FIXD translates your vehicle into simple English, empowering you to make the easy fix in many cases & saving you precious time. FIXD also saves you money by providing you with estimated repair costs up-front, allowing you to feel more confident during those trips to the mechanic

The Trusted Choice — FIXD is the professional choice proudly designed in the USA by Professional Engineers and ASE Certified Mechanics. Get unlimited access to over 10,000 manufacturer specific and enhanced trouble codes (ABS, Airbag, TPMS, and Transmission*). With the App, you’ll have freeze frame data, live diagnostic data, and proactive vehicle maintenance reminders at your fingertips. All the capabilities of an expensive Scan Tool at a fraction of the cost

Easy & Intuitive — The powerful FIXD OBD-II Diagnostic Sensor and the professionally designed FIXD App are the perfect pair. The FIXD Code Reader is light & compact, remaining out-of-sight during your drive. The FIXD Sensor connects to the FIXD App via Bluetooth in seconds, providing you with a suite of resources easy enough for anyone to use

We've Got You Covered — The FIXD OBD 2 Scan Tool is compatible with all gas-powered vehicles made after 1996 (no all-electric or diesel) and works with all vehicle protocols. Works with iPhone, iPad, and Android devices

Go further with FIXD Premium— Upgrade your in-app experience with: Cost and repair estimates from the Identifix database, Unlimited calls to our FIXD Mechanic Hotline for a trusted second opinion and DIY help from our network of ASE certified mechanics, And much more! FIXD Premium is a monthly subscription that is optional and is not required for use of the sensor

specifications.Special Features: Live Data: Display multiple PIDs as a graph, gauge, or chart. Other available displays include fighter jet, trip, and 0 to 60 mode, Diagnostic Reports: Code Definition, simplified explanation with additional resources for repairs, Freeze Frame: Vehicle snapshot when a code is stored, Timeline: Get access to manufacturer specific service intervals, Read Enhanced Codes: e.g. ABS, Airbag, Transmission, TPMS, etc for Ford, Chrysler, Toyota, Nissan, and Honda
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars6,548 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
